Activity: Arrive at the office. Check emails and calendar for urgent matters. Prioritize tasks based on urgency and impact.
Review project plan and SMART goals document. Ensure all teams are aligned and prepared for the week's tasks.
Weekly project status meeting with all team leads (@larch-1, @qres-1, @dsde-1, @comp-1, @ir-1, @onbd-1). Discuss progress against SMART goals, identify roadblocks, and coordinate solutions.
Document action items from the project status meeting and assign responsibility to relevant team members.
Follow up with team leads on assigned action items and ensure timely completion.
Lunch. Network with other project managers in the Finance industry to share best practices and lessons learned.
Work with @devops-1 to ensure the infrastructure is in place for the data science and quantitative research teams to perform backtesting and model validation.
Meet with @facc-1 and @facc-2 to discuss fund accounting procedures and reporting requirements. Ensure alignment with regulatory standards.
Review the risk management plan with @comp-1 and @qres-1. Identify any new potential risks and update mitigation strategies accordingly.
Monitor team progress against SMART goals. Identify any teams that are falling behind and provide support to get them back on track.
Prepare a weekly progress report for COO and CIO, highlighting key achievements, challenges, and upcoming activities.
Finalize daily tasks and prepare for tomorrow's schedule.
